intro: Harpochilus paraibanus, commonly known as the Paraíba orchid, is a tropical epiphytic plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has fleshy, strap-like leaves and produces inflorescences that bear numerous small, fragrant orchid flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in greenhouses and botanical gardens.
